The movie is highly entertaining.
It is an entertaining family movie with a nice plot and a lot of action. Aamir was on point as always and I loved his character. Mr. Bachchan is a legend and he's in that stage of his career by my opinion , in which it is enough for him just to be in the movie. Fatima was a delight to watch. Someone I really liked is the girl playing young Zafira (Deshna Dugad). She's done pretty well for the small role she had and for her young age.


PROS: Aamir Khan, Amitabh Bachchan, and Fatima Sana Shaikh. While Amitabh and Fatima did not have much material, every time they were on screen, they were extremely impressive with the stunts in their fight sequences. The two of them also have a nice character arc that I wont spoil. And Aamir Khan is always the best. Just because he acts cheerful and full of energy, doesn't mean he is Jack Sparrow as some people believe. The fight sequences are really, really well-done, especially for a Bollywood movie with amazing fight choreography, realistic looking ships and outstanding visual effects. The VFX were nowhere near as bad as some people have so harshly dismissed. The background score is great. Its generally a feel-good film. This is the perfect popcorn entertainer that will make you laugh and keep your spirits high with terrific action sequences and good acting.

CONS: The story could have been a little more complex. Some of the editing in the fight sequences, at times was a little choppy, although  were great!  The movie could have been a little shorter.

All in all, it is a simple, straightforward story that feels like a summer blockbuster entertainer. So , in conclusion, if you are in a mood for an entertaining action , the movie will leave you with a good feeling. Give it a try..
So truly bizarre a film that in half a generation it will have a cult following, much as Plan 9 From Outer Space does.

Listen.... Thugs of Hindostan is not a bad movie; a good one, as a matter of fact. My rating a 3.5/5, is supreme. Thugs of Hindostan is a fresh 'light bulb' and theme in Bollywood cinema, consisted of great acting throughout, how the story unfolded was also appreciated, as it was very enjoyable and 'you' might be surprised note this but the story was good. However, before delving into the perks of the story, Amitabh Bachchan and Aamir Khan are in pivotal roles, but as to the story, Fatima Sana Shaikh is more at centre than you think. 

With a very simple story; two thugs want to overthrow 'Clive' and his group. Since they can't because 'Clive's' army is very strong, 'Clive' hires another thug to simply brush them off. After the thug realises that one cannot just simply brush off Amitabh and Fatima (because of their relationship and strength). As a solution he decided to first falsely join forces with them and later overthrow them as an infiltrator. Continuing on with the solution the thug decided to actually join forces with Amitabh and Fatima to overthrow the 'Clive' together. 

Although each character had thier motivation, the direction should have emerged that stronger.  Duration is a big part of a movie, especially Hindi cinema, this movie was prolonged for a bit too much.

Before I watched this movie, all I heard and saw were negative reviews - which made it hard to sit on the padded sea of the cinema without prejudice for an apparently bad movie.

But, I kept waiting for the movie to get slow/ stale/ boring - but it never happened!!! Thugs of Hindostan is a fantastic action flick with a production and direction team that has not been scared to take bold steps to direct the Bollywood industry to a newer, more conceptual artform.

To make it really simple, I will summarize this movie in a series of highlights (pros) and dampeners (cons):

Highlights:

Note: First things first - this movie is nothing like Pirates of Carribean and follows it's own original theme and storyline, So, I encourage all those thinking this is a remake of Pirate of the Carrieban to please go to the cinema and o be proven wrong.

1. Amitabh Bachchan has outdone himself in this role. His character is strong, uncompromising and very convincing. His acting has matured majestically with age. His role was very reminiscent of Optimus Prime in this movie in all the good ways.

2. Aamir Khan always exceeds expectations in any role he is given - so much so that if a film fails, it as never because of him, but due to other factors surrounding the movie. It is hard to imagine anyone else doing this role with the ease and charisma that Aamir has done it. His coyness and personality is the base for all suspense of this movie an he portrays his uncharacteristic nature of being unpredictable beautifully in this movie.

3. Background Score - The movie's background score is a perfect complement to the vibe and look of the movie. It is a sort of a beautiful amalgamation of SHerlock Holmes meets POTC meets Lagaan. It is melodic, it is engrossing and it is perfect.

Dampeners (cons):

1. Katrina Kaif - I feel bad that a wonderful actress who has done her part beautifully in the movie was let down by the nubile character of her role that just seems to exist to be an item number in the movie and pave the way for some racy songs.

That being said, her dance was mind blowing where she was able to exhibit the levels of which he had trained for the movie. She handled some particularly daring steps an techniques with such grace and ease. But - though it was impressive, it wasn't mind blowing as it was supposed to be. It has nothing to do with Katrina's dancing or acting - but poor costume choice/ choreography that just seemed to distance itself from the music and to exhibit more skin. The songs she was in felt like such a deviation from the rest of the movie.

2. Stunts involving high/ long leaps : Bollywood has reached a level of amazing graphical capabilities and this movie is one of the testaments to it. The sea, sailing, ships and action sequences were believable and did not seem too artificial like the usual Bollywood norm. But =, the industry still seems lacking to manage long and high leaps of the actors and the editing shifting into multiple shots from the time a person starts the jump to when he lands and gets up seems artificial and interfered with the flow of an otherwise good action sequence throughout the movie.

Summary: ToH is a movie that is designed to entertain all the emotional aspects of the spectrum and not to be taken too seriously. It is fun for all ages and has a little bit of everything. It is a movie that will give you goosebumps at the right moments and actually manages some decent laughs due to it's sense of humor that is carried around Aamir's character.

Go without expectations to the cinema and wear a sweater (as it is around 3 hours long) and you will come out with that good feeling you get when you do only one of 3 things - watching a good movie/ after having a good meal/ after emptying a full bladder.

CHeers.

This is a review of a Bollywood movie that all Indians were excited to see, because it stars two of Bollywood's biggest and best actors, together. Imagine, HEAT with Al Pacino and Robert Dinero, and that was a classic masterpiece. This movie gets a ZERO out of 5 stars. I went to see this with so much excitement, and it was just a giant waste of time. This is 100% the director's fault. The director, Vijay Krishna Acharya is so bad, I can't believe it. I can't believe this is the same guy that directed DHOOM !! This guy should never be allowed to direct another movie again. You have two of the BEST ACTORS to ever come out of India, and you turn one into a clown, and another ...the legendary Amitabh Bachchan was shown in slow motion over and over, with no substance or great dialogue, nothing. I mean come on man!! We all wanted to see him act...not move in slow motion. What is wrong with India's director's and their obsession with slow motion, in repeat?? Who told you this is cool?? The plot is horrible...and at one point, I felt like I was watching a movie from the 80's. Katrina Kaif pretty much wears skimpy outfits, shows off her well-defined body, in vulgar dance movies which take away from the movie. The trailer makes it look like she is a lead actress, but she is basically an item number girl with two songs and very skimpy clothes with nothing of substance. I mean I could go on and on, but DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME PAYING TO WATCH THIS CRAP. Very soon this will be on TV for Free, trust me. I am sure after watching himself on screen, Amitabh Bachchan is regretting doing this movie. What a waste of a huge opportunity...two icons on India cinema on screen...and ZERO memorable scenes or dialogues. This director should never direct again. INDIAN DIRECTORS; PLEASE STOP Showing every freaken shot in slow motion....it's outdated, and not cool. TV serials all over again!!! Ok,...rant over. Go watch A STAR IS BORN or BOHEMIAN RHAPSODY Instead...you will love it. Vijay Krishna Acharya...I normally never do this, but man you wasted an opportunity of a lifetime. I guess that is what I am upset about most. AB and AK together....could have been such a huge movie!!!
I don't know what movie the others saw, but I thought  this movie was amazing!  For diehard Bachchan fans it's a must see!!!

Although I wound up liking this movie better than I thought I would, it's certainly not without  its serious and many flaws. It was entertaining and had some fun scenes but at the  same time the movie was a clear knock off of Pirates of the Caribbean with a little Bahubali thrown in instead of being original in any way. I went to see this movie because of the cast, especially Amitabh Bachchan , Aamir Khan and Fatima Shaikh but wish they had better material to work with. Also wondering why Katrina Kaif was in this,  she didn't really add enough to the movie to justify her role.

"Thugs of Hindostan" isn't quite as unwatchably bad as you may have heard, but I wouldn't call it a good movie either. I feel the movie has a few decent action scenes but the character development is very one dimensional. The movie comes off as a disappointment because it showcases two great actors, Aamir Khan, and Amitabh Bachchan. In their defense, I think their performances are probably the best part of this movie but it's not enough to save a messily paced story. It's far from the worst movie of 2018 but it is also far from the best, and its definitely one of the biggest let downs in recent Bollywood.
